newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Dutch call money rates slip on ample allocation.
newsitem.headline: Dutch call money rates slip on ample allocation.

text.p: Dutch call money rates slipped in slow Friday trade, pushed lower by an ample allocation under the advances pact, dealers said.

The Dutch central bank said on Friday it had allocated 4.64 billion guilders to the money market under a seven-day special advances pact at an unchanged rate of 2.90 percent. Individual banks received 17.1 percent of the amount they had applied for.
"The allocation was somewhat ample," said one dealer, but added that call money rates were unlikely to drop much further.
Call money was bid at around 2.88 percent compared with 3.00 percent on Thursday.
The guilder was fractionally weaker versus the German mark at 112.555 per 100 marks compared with 112.545 on Thursday.
